There are those—anarchists, for example—who argue that any political associa­ tion that rests on the possibility of coercion cannot be covenantal. This writer clearly rejects that position. A state association can be fully covenantal if it is internally constituted on the right principles, that is, if it is compounded of free citizens and is linked with other state associations in a federal manner
